testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlHARMessageInventoryRequest dialog as an OC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.5.7.9 [Need to Share HAR Messages] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine the dialog performance requirement for Send HAR Messages Upon Request (NTRM 3.3.5.8.7.1}. RECORD this value as: TMDD_N69R818_Send_HAR_Messages_Upon_Request_Parameter = ${TMDD_N69R818_Send_HAR_Messages_Upon_Request_Parameter}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Restrictions - HAR Message Inventory is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.8.7.5.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N69R824_Restrictions___HAR_Message_Inventory_Supported = ${TMDD_N69R824_Restrictions___HAR_Message_Inventory_Supported}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether HAR Message Date and Time Change Information is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.8.7.5.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N69R825_HAR_Message_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported = ${TMDD_N69R825_HAR_Message_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported}

Step 5 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Restrictions - Error Report is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.1.4.1.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N69R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported = ${TMDD_N69R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported}
Step 6 CONFIGURE: Define the message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: RequestMessage: ${RequestMessage}
Step 7 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 8 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}

Step 9 REQUEST-RESPONSE-EC with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlHARMessageInventoryRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N69R818_Send_HAR_Messages_Upon_Request_Parameter REQUESTMESSAGE = RequestMessage ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected

Step 10 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 10.1 VERIFY that a hARMessageInventoryMsg message was received.
Step 10.2 VERIFY that an organization-information data frame exists within each instance of data frame hARMessageInventoryMsg.har-message-inventory-item
Step 10.3 VERIFY that a device-id data element exists within each instance of data frame hARMessageInventoryMsg.har-message-inventory-item
Step 10.4 VERIFY that a message-number data element exists within each instance of data frame hARMessageInventoryMsg.har-message-inventory-item
Step 10.5 VERIFY that a current-message data element exists within each instance of data frame hARMessageInventoryMsg.har-message-inventory-item
Step 10.6 IF TMDD_N69R824_Restrictions___HAR_Message_Inventory_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 10.6.1 VERIFY that a restrictions data frame exists within each instance of data frame hARMessageInventoryMsg.har-message-inventory-item
Step 10.7 IF TMDD_N69R825_HAR_Message_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 10.7.1 VERIFY that a last-update-time data frame exists within each instance of data frame hARMessageInventoryMsg.har-message-inventory-item
Step 10.8 VERIFY that the values within the RESPONSE message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 11 IF ErrorResponseExpected is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 11.1 VERIFY that an errorReportMsg message was received.
Step 11.2 VERIFY that an organization-information data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 11.3 VERIFY that an organization-requesting data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 11.4 VERIFY that an error-code data element exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 11.5 VERIFY that an error-text data element exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 11.6 VERIFY that data element error-code is set to ErrorResponseTypeExpected.
Step 11.7 IF TMDD_N69R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 11.7.1 VERIFY that a restrictions data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 12 EXIT
